snippet: The president’s initiative, which would expand educational opportunities for millions, is another attempt to address persistent income inequality.
abstract: Pres Obama says he will introduce plan to make community colleges tuition-free for millions of students, in attempt to respond to rising income inequality; program would be paid for by federal government and participating states, but will probably not be welcomed by Republican Congress; Obama plans to make initiative part of his budget proposal.

byline.original: By JULIE HIRSCHFELD DAVIS and TAMAR LEWIN
byline.contributor: Julie Hirschfeld Davis reported from Washington, and Tamar Lewin from New York. Peter Baker contributed reporting from Washington.

lead_paragraph: The president’s initiative, which would expand educational opportunities for millions, is another attempt to address persistent income inequality.

headline.main: Obama Plan Would Help Many Go to Community College Free
headline.print_headline: Obama Plan Would Help Many Go to Community College Free
